comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of August 30, 1920 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F30913F63455157A9... announces the wedding of the former Mrs. Hugo Reisinger (a widow since 1914) to Charles E. Greenhough. She was the Edmee, daughter of Adolphus Busch, the brewer.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: LOC, I know you are off today due to the goverment shutdown, but note on your return, hopefully quite soon: Apparently, his name was Greenough, not Greenhough: From a Yale obituary for her second husband, Mr. Greenough: CHARLES EDWARD GREENOUGH, Ph.B . 1902. Born October 23, 1880, New York, N.Y., died May 11, 1952, Bronx, N.Y. [...] Married (2) August 28, 1920, Little Boar's Head, N. H., Edmee Busch Reisinger, daughter of Mr. & Mrs Adolphus Busch. mssa.library.yale.edu/obituary_record/1925_1952/1951-52.pdf mssa.library.yale.edu/obituary_record/1925_1952/1951-52.txt An account of an auction at the Plaza of her first husband's art collection ran in the New York Press, 1/19/1916. She was a bidder in the auction as well. fultonhistory.com/Newspaper%2018/New%20York%20NY%20Press/...
